sub_topic: Coordination chemistry of lanthanides and actinides
message_1: What is the coordination number of the europium ion in the complex [Eu(H2O)9]3+ ? How many unpaired electrons are present in the europium ion in this complex and what is its magnetic moment?
message_2:
The coordination number of the europium ion in the complex [Eu(H2O)9]3+ is 9. This is because there are 9 water molecules (H2O) surrounding and bonded to the europium ion (Eu).

Europium is a member of the lanthanide series and has an atomic number of 63. Its electronic configuration is [Xe] 4f7 6s2. In the [Eu(H2O)9]3+ complex, the europium ion has a +3 charge, which means it loses its 2 electrons from the 6s orbital and 1 electron from the 4f orbital. So, the electronic configuration of Eu3+ is [Xe] 4f6.

There are 6 unpaired electrons in the 4f orbital of the europium ion in this complex.

To calculate the magnetic moment, we can use the formula:

μ = √(n(n+2)) BM (Bohr Magneton)

where n is the number of unpaired electrons.

μ = √(6(6+2)) BM
μ = √(6(8)) BM
μ = √48 BM

The magnetic moment of the europium ion in the [Eu(H2O)9]3+ complex is approximately √48 Bohr Magnetons.
